result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Ray Goforth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael Ray Goforth is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael Ray Goforth was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 3:19 pm.  DA Gill, Atty Yang, and Mr. Goforth appeared.  Defendant enters plea of "guilty".  Court accepts plea as entered freely, voluntarily, and knowingly.Amend Count 1 to 
947.01(1).  Court orders defendant sentenced to 20 days in the Lafayette County Jail with Huber privileges commencing 3/16/17 concurrent to any other sentence he may be serving. Defendant shall
pay costs.   Defendant requests payment plan.  Court orders Count 2 be dismissed.
for bail reduction
